website_summaries.verdict: Offering robust connectivity, support for digital pens, and good battery life, the Lenovo Flex 5 Chromebook is a capable 2-in-1 convertible laptop for Chrome devotees.

customer_reviews.title: Update after six months
customer_reviews.text: After six months of use the right hinge broke and started flexing the screen out. Looks like a bad design. Lenovo repair has you fill out a repair ticket but no info as where to send it, RMA or any other info. I have laptops that are over four years old and dont have any problems with hinges.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it’s just as good as I thought it would be. It’s well made and very fast! My other laptop that runs windows 10 has a i7, 8GB of ram, and a SSD. This feels just as fast (or faster) for half the price and better portability.
customer_reviews.author: Tim jr

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive build quality
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today so it's still early. Very impressed so far with the speed and build quality. All around a great value for a solid Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: David O.

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a week and can say this is easily worth the money. Feels like a $600 CB. The screen is good, the build is excellent and the 4gb is not an issue at all. The keyboard is backlit and feels great to type on. The i3 hasn't slowed down anything I've thrown at it and yes it isn't fanless but the fan can only be heard under really heavy use in an almost quiet room. The only issue right now is there aren't many USI stylus available to buy but that isn't really Lenovo's fault. I don't see how at this isn't the best Chromebook for the price that you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris V

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for my Mom through Amazon. The Core i3 model. It's amazing and she loves it. I don't think you can go wrong here. Everything about this rocks, being able to fold the display, the screen, the touchpad, the speaks by the keyboard. This sets the bar for Chromebooks at this price point. Her only issue is the maximum volume of the speakers isn't quite as loud as she'd like, but she is hearing impaired. I like the keyboard better than the Pixelbook Go that I have and costs 2x as much.
customer_reviews.author: MrZipf

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a Macbook Air
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. She was using a 2013 Macbook Air. Over the years she;s shifted more and more to the browser. I have been using Chromebooks for years. She tried one of my cheap HP Chromebooks and liked the OS. I watched a few Youtube reviews on this Lenovo and was sold. Great screen (don't buy 720 P screens...ick), backlit keyboard, high quality cameras and great build quality. The touchscreen isn't needed but a nice touch. The price is right in the middle of the pack...but the features and specs are on the higher end.
customer_reviews.author: D. BYRD

customer_reviews.title: Broke Instantly; screen had flaws.
customer_reviews.text: The screen's uniform brightness shifted somewhat if not straight on. The right hinge broke less than 24 hrs of opening. The corners had light bleed on dark scenes. There was a faint black spot (clouding) in the bottom middle. I returned instantly. Other than that, it was fast and the speakers were okay. I played BTD6 (android store); the game looked worse than the PC version and it dropped frames. I understand the Chrome OS doesn't work the greatest with Android apps. After this experience, I'm not sure I would purchase again. I really wanted to like it but these issues were a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-range Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Chromebook. I do a lot of my work with my G-suite apps so this made sense for me. The build quality is superb. The keyboard is very nice and backlit. The screen is bright and the 360 degree hinge makes it extra convenient. I doubt I will use it much in tablet mode but it is nice to know I have the option. Overall I am very happy with this computer.
customer_reviews.author: JoMacon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Solid 5
customer_reviews.text: I was just thinking of getting a new Chromebook when I ran across a review by this one blogger I read a lot. He was so high on this Chromebook I started to research it. A couple of bloggers I read said just buy it! Said it was a $400 device with $600 specs. I was a little concerned about the 4gb of memory but with the i3 processor I decided to take the plunge. Glad I did. It's solid, fast, great screen and has a great feel. The 4gb is not a problem. I'm not seeing some of the other concerns here in some Amazon reviews. Lots of Pros...no Cons. Would recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good budget chromebook, just not what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chromebook for the price, all things considered. Very fast, perfect keyboard, awesome battery life, etc... My only issue is I need a Chromebook that will function with a stylus, and finding the right stylus for a product that is supposedly USI complaint has been a struggle. Per recommendations by Lenovo support and others, I have now tried both the Lenovo Active Pen 1 and the Lenovo Active Pen 2 with zero success. At this point, I may have to step up to another product to meet my needs. If you just need a standard Chromebook, this is a no-brainer. If you need more, you might need to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: W. Scott Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product and value
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the most supreme sweet spot for a Chromebook/laptop so far. Got this for an elder. Feedback was "amazing" and easy setup immediately synced with phone apps and bookmarks etc. Bonus is the keyboard is really good for typing and big letters/numbers make it easy even without reading glasses or whatever. Touchscreen works perfect, no lag or double-pressing.
customer_reviews.author: peterfram

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I've been a 'chromebooker' since 2012 and this is my fourth one. The fit and finish are excellent. I was concerned that the 4 GB of ram would be too little, but it hasn't presented any problems. The camera is standard 720 and mediocre, but works fine and has the advantage of erasing some of the lines of age in the face because it is not as sharp as it could be!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great value, even for a Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Decided to replace my laptop with a Chromebook and was the best decision. You can't get anything better for this price, great value. Fantastic keyboard and real sturdy hinge system. Web browsing is as zippy as my wife's Dell XPS. It is able to run Stadia games flawlessly. The Google ecosystem also makes it real easy to set up a kids account for safety. One thing I would note is that the webcam is average and wouldn't be a good fit for professional web meetings but once again, this is a $400 machine we are talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Camera didn't activate. Waste of time. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment. Camera inoperative. Contacted Lenovo. Tried a power wash. Didn't work. They said I had to send it in for repairs. Why would I do that when I can send it back to Amazon for a refund? Spent hours and hours setting it up. Waste of time. Lenovo never again!
customer_reviews.author: REY BUONO

customer_reviews.title: Solid Chromebook under 3lbs with great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It was time to upgrade my Lenovo 500e Chromebook to something with a larger screen and thinner bezels. The up-firing speakers are nice and the backlit keyboard is another bonus. This feels like a premium Chromebook for a mid-range price. So far very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: mikepdx

customer_reviews.title: Camera DOA and screen unstable
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook feels like a premium computer. However, the camera was DOA. Also disturbing, the screen would suddenly go black. Clicking on Enter would bring back the screen to a blank Chrome browser. Sometimes there was a button to restore the tabs, but sometimes the button was absent. People should also know that the computer has ventilation slots on the bottom and back which requires the computer be used on a hard surface. This last was OK with me because I use my laptops at a desk or table.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this Lenovo Chromebook Flex 13 inch. It has the backlit keyboard, all new 10th generation processor which makes it nice and fast. I like the idea of the touchscreen with the flex so that you can use it in any position. No spyware needed for the Chromebook. Very solid and nice grey color and speakers are good. Really enjoying this chromebook and it was money well spent. Lenovo did a good job with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gopher69

customer_reviews.title: Good deal with some annoying quirks
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good computer at a good price for kids doing online schooling this Fall. In a week of ownership I have 2 big complaints. The pen compatibility is ridiculous. The Flex 5 14" and 15" models use the Active Pen, and lots of those pens advertise as being "compatible with Flex 5". But this 13" version is only compatible with one HP pen that is not in stock anywhere. Also, I was expecting Linux availability, since it's an Intel CPU. But that option is not showing in the settings menu. So if your kid is expecting to play Minecraft, they're going to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Err2

customer_reviews.title: love this chromebook
customer_reviews.text: just got this for my mom moving her from Windows. love this device for the price its really nice. started out opened up chrome on windows signed in and dragged all her files to drive.google.com. then opened this laptop signed in and she was all set. if i had to name a flaw would be that intel i3 does run warm/hot. you will feel the fan come up which was odd for a chromebook and a little heat. nothing crazy or abnormal but i have a windows intel laptop and it does the same thing and my mac.. intel... does tooo. you wont truly notice it just an fyi its an intel inside...
customer_reviews.author: Q. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I think it's incredible for the price. Keyboard is great, trackpad works fine, screen is difficult to clean, I have no problem with 4GB of RAM and the "screen bleed" some reviewers whine about doesn't seem to be a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: trouble finding compatible stylus
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my significant other. Overall he loves it, the screen/display is beautiful and the backlighting for the keyboard makes it look really cool. The only issue is he wanted to get a stylus to use with it and cannot seem to find one that works with this product. He has ordered two and had to send them back because even though they say they are compatible, they have not been. Perhaps because the laptop is so new?
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and responsive Chromebook works well with kindergartner virtual learning.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Chromebook for our rising kindergartner who is starting this year in full virtual learning. The battery holds through the entire school day and still has 20-30% power left at the end of the day when we open it to check for assignments. The processor doesn't seem to have any issues powering through the videos or online assignments that our 5 year old has to do as part of his virtual learning. And the chassis is solid and doesn't flex or bend when he's opening it or adjusting the screen tilt. All-in-all, this is a well-made product and is working well so far (a month into use).
customer_reviews.author: shelcu

customer_reviews.title: good notebook, not a tablet
customer_reviews.text: I want a decent Chromebook tablet. I tried the duet but it's slow and lags. the i3 processor here works much better but it's too cumbersome, thick, and heavy to bend the keyboard around and use this as a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with a stylus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter so she could try out some drawing apps, but unfortunately I did not do my research. We tried 8 different stylus pens and they either did not work at all or managed to get a few squiggles. My daughter was very dissapointed and now we are at the point where it is to late to return the chromebook. If you have any plans to draw go with something else, probably and ipad. If you just need a computer, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: glory2trinity

customer_reviews.title: Best computer I ever had!
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, really fast. A Chromebook that has an Intel Core i3 will fly and this certainly does. I love the touch screen. It responds perfect. I got it at around $400 and the price has gone up a little. I did a lot of homework and for the price it's in its own class. It's awesome! Check out YouTube video reviews to get a better look at it. I bought it in June and I'm still crazy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Trackpad issues
customer_reviews.text: Although i have minimum hours on this chrome book, I've had multiple instances of the trackpad not working. It appears to freeze, not allowing me to use the pad as a mouse and forcing me to use the touch screen. I've scoured the web and youtube and tried everything suggested. Sometimes the hard-reboot works ('circle-arrow' + power button) on restart, but most of the time it does not. One night it just started working again with no action performed. This is very frustrating and seems to occur often for others, but others cant have it occur as often as I do. Help, this is driving me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Fird

customer_reviews.title: It’s a lemon; sending it back
customer_reviews.text: Chromebook arrived and was packed well and didn’t appear to have been opened or damaged, but it didn’t seem able to work through the typical setup process either. Would not connect to our wifi. Once it appeared to connect but wouldn’t allow us to connect to Google or any other website. Kept reloading network error message repeatedly even after it appeared to successfully connect. Tried resetting it and starting over, with same results. Packed it up and we’re shipping it back. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Gal

customer_reviews.title: Extremely buggy for just about everything
customer_reviews.text: Chromebook works alright as a web browser, but not much else. None of the android apps work correctly. They are all stuck in a hard to use orientation. Some apps that work perfectly on our phone and on the iPad, like Zoom or Messenger Kids, just randomly freeze and lock up the whole system. We bought this for our daughter to use for classes and chatting with her friends, and we are very disappointed with it as the two main apps are just awful.
customer_reviews.author: James T Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for remote education!
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook works smoothly for my needs as a SPED TA. I can be on multiple Google Meets at the same time and have several other tabs open simultaneously. Flawless transitions between apps. The battery life is incredible! It gets me through the entire school day easily on one charge with more to spare. I would definitely recommend it for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kigz

customer_reviews.title: For the money a great chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: For what it is intended for a great value. Easy to set up and use,very light, long lasting battery-12 hours I got out of it. Very nice screen and very fast start up.The keyboard is a bit small and will take some getting used to.I love this product and now I am worried that I won't use my other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great chromebook for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Speedy laptop and very responsive. The keyboard has nice travel and the touchpad feels good even if it's plastic. The core i3 is plenty powerful if needed to run Linux programs. Finally the price of this machine is simply amazing for the features packed in.My only gripes would be the storage and screen quality. Would've preferred 128gb but 64 gb is sufficient. The screen looks amazing but in dark environments, too much brightness reveals a lot a bleeding around the edges but not necessarily awful depending on your lighting conditions. This machine, even with it's faults is basically a no brainier to buy for it's price as it provides enough features to the table with few drawbacks.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lazo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it simple... Like - Solid build feel - Aluminum top shell - Back-lit keyboard that auto shuts off! - Nice and speedy for regular use - Keyboard is excellent - Nice sharp screen* Dislike - Speakers are low and tinny *- Screen needs to be a bit brighter
customer_reviews.author: Richard DeBlasio

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable easy to use laptop
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyable easy to use laptop, well made, features are great, Chrome works well and supports all the software we use. The versatility of this pc is great, regular laptop position, fold it over to use it like a tablet, plus even in the touch screen mode if you need a keyboard will popup! Nicely thought out ite,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken speakers
customer_reviews.text: its a fairly nice computer but the speaker is broken. The audio clips at the high points of the audio so bad it makes my ears ring. It came like this and i am incredibly disappointed. I've been trying to figure it out for literally 3 days and its been a nightmare
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Davis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this purchase. The computer was defective and stopped working after only two months. According to both Lenovo and Amazon my only recourse is to send it back for repair. If Lenovo or Amazon think this is how to provide customer satisfaction they are wrong. I wont buy another Lenovo product and the next computer I buy wont be from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Max E.

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to return this item. After less than a week of use I noticed that the touch screen was glitchy. It wouldn’t let me click on things occasionally...this happening so quickly meant there was no chance I was keeping it. Aside from that problem I actually did quite like the device! Wish it had worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannemq

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook for Online Learning
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent laptop for school, now that everything has been moved to live online and online. Camera is passable, but the rest of this device well built. Good design, and reliable Lenovo Yoga-like convertible. Does not feel cheap and toy-ish like other Chromebooks. Battery life can be destroyed by Zoom, but what laptop battery life isn’t diminished by remote meeting sessions all day.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Weidner

customer_reviews.title: Great value purchase until this happened...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device. The great value faded when, in just over three months after purchase, the system no longer charges! Lenovo support? Ship unit to them (I pay). Upon receipt of the unit, they'll fix and return in ten (!) business days! That puts me about a month out of commission. Value? Nope. Cheap. Yes.
customer_reviews.author: Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome computer
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my younger brother who just finished highschool and he loves it. It's a very cool machine; the 2 in 1 touch screen and laptop combo is awesome and you can tell the laptop is good quality. The keyboard feels great and easy and the screen has a really good picture. The chrome OS is much faster than Windows and seems way less buggy (plus you don't have to worry about any virus protection). Excluding any CPU intensive gaming, I think this computer can handle almost everything my brother will need from it. For the price/quality this is really a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Rosemond

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It is not what i expected. I wish i would not have decided on chromebook or at least this one. Several things I dont like but the biggest I read it was light weight but sturdy its not light weight at all. Picture quality is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I paid more than I normally would for a chromebook for my son at school and I’m sorry I did. He dropped this on carpeting in his classroom and the screen shattered and hinge broke. Way too much damage for such a minor incident.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I would not have ought this had they mentioned it was not combatible with a printer, then I paid almost 28 bucks to ship it back and got only a 400 refund 100 dollars short of what amazon is charging to my account very expensive lesson I learned
customer_reviews.author: jinx

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: If you like Chromebooks, this is a great 2 in 1 laptop. Easy to set up and boots up right away. I wanted a basic laptop and this works great for me. Includes USB ports, micro SD card slot, Bluetooth compatible for headphones, charges fast.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: A great Chromebook, nicely priced.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive light laptop for casual use and I am happy with this Lenovo. I like that I can link it with my Android phone and it unlocks the computer. The screen is fine and I have no complaints about the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: A keycap came damaged and won't stay on. I've been unable to find replacement caps for this model either from Lenovo or from 3rd party suppliers. Unfortunately the original packaging was thrown away before I noticed the defect. I hope I'm not stuck with this damaged laptop.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for education
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter for school. It was a great deal. She uses the tablet feature a lot. The screen is great resolution and the size is perfect for her needs. I hope this will last her until high school.
customer_reviews.author: Audralyniler

customer_reviews.title: looks and works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for granddaughter for school. really like the features, sd card, 2 usb charge ports on either side. seems plenty fast on bootup and operation. Im sure it will serve her well through high school
customer_reviews.author: T. Small

customer_reviews.title: meh at best
customer_reviews.text: specs looked great on paper/screen, but...mouse pad and screens is often unresponsive to finger touch/click, very frustrating. speakers volume also sucks when in tablet/yoga mode. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: forReals

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook Out There
customer_reviews.text: Everything you want a Chromebook to do is done perfectly in this Lenovo except for the sound could be a little louder. Camera is top notch, live video sessions are amazing, the screen flips for touchscreen gaming, the keyboard is backlit for night time working, the speakers are located on top, which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: neil

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop for the money
customer_reviews.text: Really nice laptop. Probably the nicest keyboard I've ever typed on. Quality materials. My only complaint is that the fan comes on often. Probably not a dealbreaker for most, but it's a little annoying. Other than that it's very very nice, especially considering the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This chromebook checks all the boxes
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chromebook for two weeks and it's been working like a champ. I bought this as an upgrade for my previous chromebook and it's like night and day. The Flex 5 is faster, the screen is so much clearer, the laptop itself feels so much more solid and well built, and the speakers are a huge improvement. Add the touch screen, tablet mode, and back-lit keyboard and it equals a very good product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Carry this around and use for everything. Very Fine machine🙂
customer_reviews.author: M D B

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Chromebook, and this has exceeded my expectations. The laptop is well-built, and FAST! If you use mostly the web day to day, then this will be a perfect daily driver.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and high build quality
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the school-issued Chromebooks, this is a completely different level of quality. Faster, better screen, better keyboard. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Upstater

customer_reviews.title: Good chromebook but maybe a bit overpriced given its limitations.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good quality phonebook but I can't give it 5 stars because it won't download some of the software/apps I need which is one of the main reasons I bought it, so I may need to buy something else. This may end up going to my son for his schoolwork instead. However, no complaints with the seller or delivery.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Best chromebook for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for the best i3 chromebook and this did not disappoint. All the features are great and the processor is powerful and plenty of memory. Has been excellent for the kids remote learning.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook for the price
customer_reviews.text: I decided to make the switch to chromebook and never looking back. Love how simple it is to use and can use my phone apps on it as well
customer_reviews.author: Joby

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son with special needs because of the touch screen to make using the computer easier. After 2 weeks the touch screen does not work and I can't get anyone to help resolve the issue. Don't buy from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Until now, this is an amazing laptop. The design, quality and weight are all excellent. Hope it lasts for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cozmo

customer_reviews.title: A little gem
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it, light , fast, and love the touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Iliana G

customer_reviews.title: Best lab top for only ver 400 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Best lab top I ever owned . Smooth to the touch very sturdy and about the best product I ever bought on amazon . It is super sleek , very quick and the quality over all excellent, highly recommend buying this labtop
customer_reviews.author: Silvia G.

customer_reviews.title: Good machine, great value
customer_reviews.text: For the $410 price especially, it's great. Touch screen, fast CPU, well-built, not too heavy. Most other comparable ones seem to be $100 or $200 more, and cheaper ones seem to be a lot slower.
customer_reviews.author: Apathetic

customer_reviews.title: So worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, worth every penny, I am obsessed with chromebook and just their ease of use
customer_reviews.author: Ordering Diva

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, performance and keyboard. Battery life could be better it’s goo not great. Overall best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: We ended up returning for something else but had no issues and product worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: BadKarma8049

customer_reviews.title: Missed it by that much..
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great sofar save for the Linux feature which unfortunately doesn't support the use of certain desktop apps. Very disappointed to have to settle for Android versions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors on the screen, especially my pictures. Easy to use, great battery life. Would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really, way more to like than to hate. This thing is a price performer! And this comes from someone who's hard to please! I always ask myself after having something for a while, "would I buy it again?" This one is a resounding, YES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Although it looks new, it also has a nostalgic experience ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though satisfied overally and quite fair quality/spec against price, warm device on thighs making me feel sleepy sometime, internal fan keep small noise making me feel like using device bought 5 yeas back. (It's never such on Lenovo S330 bought for my family) You may choose higher price range model if it's main purpose of intensive work indoors.
customer_reviews.author: N.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: Great chrome book.. Love speed and back-lit keyboard! Battery is good but could be better
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Ripperger

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for distance learning
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a nightmare for my son to use for distance learning. The camera doesn’t work with Zoom. The programs the teachers use won’t interact with it. Do not buy this! Get a regular laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Educator

customer_reviews.title: Overall good machine but sound is questionable
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is bad and the volume does not get high enough
customer_reviews.author: Felipe C.

customer_reviews.title: Too slow
customer_reviews.text: It’s too slow. Not sure if it is because mine has defect.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Camera is a little grainy on Zoom ... works well
customer_reviews.author: witnesstoo

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. I am a freshman in college and I needed something that more powerful then the laptop I have. The sighn in process was easy. I have an android phone so It let me log in to my Gmail and everything is saved. The settings are easy to navigate as well. I would 100% recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !
customer_reviews.text: Loving it! Easy setup . Solid build . Great computer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this Chromebook for my wife she had to replace her windows 7 pc and she loves everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: CLB

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and slow
customer_reviews.text: Very slow and buggy computer, I had an acer chromebook that was starting to slow down so I bought this and its so slow and buggy that the old computer is still faster. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: eric goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but then camera died
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook works well, but two weeks into online teaching the camera died and I am unable to use the camera feature in google meets with students. I have been in touched with Lenovo about getting the camera repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Gardner

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. Great little device for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible track pad
customer_reviews.text: Track pad was practically unusable. Returned it same day received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is awsome! Its so much better then the hp one i had bought before this one. Its fast and efficient. I love the Back light on the keyboard, its awsome in the dark. I am more then happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Just received the laptop; I was expecting this sometime next week. Shipped in a day. Set up was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Affordable 2 in 1 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and nice price. I always want to try a Chromebook and it didn't disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Jieru Chen

customer_reviews.title: Daughter's happy then I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for my HS daughter and she loves it. Very happy with the overall build quality. Was leary of the 4GB RAM but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mac R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Fast boot up and operation. Great screen. Excellent battery life. Everything is as promised. This is a great chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Windows 10 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Love the speed, ease of setup and seamless integration with android phone apps.
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: solid value for money
customer_reviews.text: Does everything well. fast processing, great screen, audio is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo L.

product_meta.title: Lenovo Chromebook Flex 5 13" Laptop, FHD (1920 x 1080) Touch Display, Intel Core i3-10110U Processor, 4GB DDR4 OnBoard RAM, 64GB SSD, Intel Integrated Graphics, Chrome OS, 82B80006UX, Graphite Grey
feature_bullets: Work from home, school, or anywhere with the outstanding combination of performance, connectivity, and entertainment enabled by 10th Generation InteI Core processors. The Lenovo Flex 5 offers intelligent performance features that adapt to you for a personalized, intuitive, and responsive experience

This 2-in-1 laptop combines a keyboard and touchscreen to make it easy to interact with everything on your display! You can also use the Lenovo digital pen (sold separately) to quickly write, click or drag files right on the screen

The 13-inch FHD display in this slim, light 360° convertible Chromebook offers beautiful visuals, while narrow bezels minimize distractions. Two user-facing stereo speakers keep you immersed in the experience
Use your Google account to easily access files, videos, music, and documents stored on the cloud from anywhere! With up to 10 hours* of battery life, you'll stay productive
Connect with the built-in webcam, 2 USB Type-C ports, a USB Type-A port, and an audio jack. It also has the latest Intel WiFi 6 and Bluetooth 5. 0 a fast, reliable connection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars148 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
